data.title: Pack Your Bags, It's Yanks Abroad (08/09 Edition v2)
data.meta_description: Here's the latest update of current, confirmed Yanks Abroad. All usual disclaimers apply. There will be things that are wrong, out-of-date, etc.,...
data.text:
Here's the latest update of current, confirmed Yanks Abroad.

All usual disclaimers apply. There will be things that are wrong, out-of-date, etc., on here, as well as things that will change very soon and -- of course -- players who are U.S. citizens but are not eligible to play for the USA.

As always, I welcome updates, corrections, additions, etc.

In addition, I'm still working through the Northern European leagues and so many guys in Finland, Norway, Ireland, Sweden and Iceland have not been confirmed and/or added back yet.

With that, 257 Yanks Abroad from Abiuso to Zizzo:

Thanks to everyone who helped me keep this as current as possible.

It's a work in progress and I hope to have more updates soon.

For reference, here the first-half thread:

https://www.bigsoccer.com/forum/showthread.php?t=765657

Thanks as always, Dave. It's amazing how many Yanks at obscure clubs have been tracked down. What really strick me was this:

Acuna Sanchez Isaac 1989 Club America Mexico

Arreola Torres Marco Felix 1988 Tigres UANL Mexico

Bolivar Grijalva Ernesto 1991 Chivas Mexico

Borja Baltazar Carlos Roberto 1988 Tapatio Mexico

Cannavina Arreola Walter Daryl 1990 Correcaminos UAT Mexico

Castillo Carillo Noel Alberto 1988 Irapuato Mexico

Escalante Diez Jorge 1991 Cuernavaca Mexico

Flores Christian 1992 Rayados de Monterrey Mexico

Flores Ornelas Andy 1992 Rojos de Jesus Maria Mexico

Gonzalez Cuevas Jose Roberto 1989 Atlante Mexico

Gutierrez Andrade Juan Carlos 1990 Leones Mexico

Juarez Rojas Gerardo 1993 Cruz Azul Mexico

Ledezma Cardenas Mario Anjel 1990 Chivas Mexico

Leyva Fierro Arham Jared 1991 Cruz Azul Mexico

Lopez Lopez Oscar Jose 1992 Tigres UANL Mexico

Mendoza Sanchez Ulises 1989 Santos Laguna Mexico

Molina Roman William Enrique 1988 Tigres UANL Mexico

Mora Quintana Hector Enrique 1990 Soles de Ciudad Juarez Mexico

Perez Aguilar Justin Allen 1992 Rayados de Monterrey Mexico

Ponce Briseno Miguel Angel 1989 Tapatio Mexico

Ruelas Aguilar Gustavo Adrian 1991 Santos Laguna Mexico

Sepulveda Castellon Sergio 1991 Atlas Mexico

Velasquez Manueles David 1991 Cruz Azul Mexico

That's a lot of Yanks who are '88s or younger. I follow YAs closely and the only names on that list that I am familiar with are Carlos Borja, Noel Castillo, and I think Jose Gonzalez if he's the same guy from a long YNT thread about him and Jose Angulo (which can't be good considering how Angulo and Brandon Manzonelli are still battling out for Biggest BigSoccer Legend).

And despite the your best efforts, I'd bet there are quite a bit more unknown YAs in Mexican academies, too. I hope that the USSF is paying attention.

On a side note, there are four players with Chivas or their second division affiliate Tapatio and that's not even counting Jesus Padilla. Soon enough Chivas will be fielding an all-American lineup!

Dave,

Great work as always. I'm sure you know that Cam Weaver was sold to San Jose yesterday. So, that is one Yank coming home form Norway. Alta IF (Norway) has a trialist (Bradford ?). He is a former UCLA palyer from Florida. I understand Alta will make a decision on him this week.

It is amazing how many U.S. players are playing all over the world. Some of the teams may be obscure, but who cares. They got to pursue their dreams, see the world, and someone else paid for it.

Thanks for the Weaver reminder and the Alta tip.

i like the way you put it mate, see the world and get someone else to pay for it hahaha, i think loads of them lads are just happy to play football in other countrys where they can get pay loads more than in the US..cheers

awesome list

Lots of former YAs (and others who've been mentioned here) apparently to play with Miami in the USL this season:

http://www.miamiherald.com/sports/story/998530.html

Tsiskaridze is someone we've written about; Edozien is a U.S. citizen who has played abroad; Hannigan played in Ireland; Merritt played in Germany; Kirby and Traynor had trials in Europe this past offseason.

Curious whether the Nicky Torres listed in the article is the one who's been in Argentina recently.
